intro: Desmopsis bibracteata, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a succulent stem and produces small, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. The species is also noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in some regions for its unique appearance.
